RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epilepsy, Childhood Absence, Susceptibility To, 1 present clinical features that include absence seizures, generalized tonic-clonic seizures, myoclonic seizures, and atypical absence seizures. The clinical features of patients with Epilepsy, Childhood Absence, Susceptibility To, 1 are similar to those of patients with Epilepsy, Juvenile Myoclonic, Susceptibility To. Some special cases also present with generalized tonic-clonic seizures. Patients with Epilepsy, Childhood Absence, Susceptibility To, 1 have a high risk of developing generalized tonic-clonic seizures.
